articles.author: Amruta Khandekar, Shristi A
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes fell in choppy trading on Thursday as losses in healthcare stocks eclipsed gains in Cisco, while upbeat economic data kept alive fears of interest rates remaining higher for longer.
articles.title: S&P 500, Dow gain on boost from Cisco

articles.author: Lisa Richwine, Dawn Chmielewski
articles.description: The striking Writers Guild of America (WGA) on Thursday urged federal regulators to increase their oversight of the streaming media business, saying Walt Disney (DIS.N), Amazon.com(AMZN.O) and Netflix (NFLX.O) had amassed too much power.
articles.title: Striking writers take antitrust aim at Disney, Amazon, Netflix

articles.author: Aishwarya Venugopal, Siddharth Cavale
articles.description: Walmart Inc (WMT.N) raised its full-year forecasts and beat second-quarter sales and profit estimates on Thursday, citing strong demand for its low-priced groceries and health and wellness products.
articles.title: Walmart raises forecasts, tops sales estimates as lower prices pull in shoppers

articles.author: Anirban Sen, David Carnevali
articles.description: U.S. Steel Corp (X.N) attracted acquisition interest after short-term challenges, including upgrading furnaces and potential car production shutdowns, weighed on its valuation, according to people familiar with the deliberations of its suitors.
articles.title: Focus: How U.S. Steel became an acquisition target

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's major state-owned banks were seen busy selling U.S. dollars to buy yuan in both onshore and offshore spot foreign exchange markets this week, people with direct knowledge of the matter said, in an attempt to arrest the yuan's rapid losses.
articles.title: Exclusive: China's major state banks sell dollars for yuan in London, NY hours - sources

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: Trucking firm Estes Express has submitted a $1.3 billion bid to acquire bankrupt Yellow Corp's shipment centers, attorneys said at a Thursday bankruptcy court hearing.
articles.title: Trucking firm Estes Express submits $1.3 bln bid for Yellow's shipment centers

articles.author: Kane Wu, Abigail Summerville
articles.description: U.S. meat and processed food maker Tyson Foods (TSN.N) plans to sell its China poultry business, three people with knowledge of the matter said, in the latest case of a multinational firm looking to divest from the country in recent years.
articles.title: Exclusive: Tyson Foods plans to sell China poultry business -sources

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: Canadian fire crews battled on Thursday to prevent wildfires from reaching the northern city of Yellowknife, where all 20,000 residents are leaving by car and plane after an evacuation order was declared.
articles.title: Canada wildfire: all 20,000 Yellowknife residents evacuating

articles.author: Ben Klayman
articles.description: Vietnamese electric-vehicle maker VinFast, which made a splash this week when its shares debuted on the Nasdaq, has stirred a mix of caution and interest among dealers with a recent change in how it will distribute its cars in the U.S. market.
articles.title: Focus: VinFast's new sales approach has US car dealers cautious but interested

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner
articles.description: A U.S. judge in Florida on Thursday declined to block the state's law barring citizens of China and other "countries of concern" from owning homes or land in the state.
articles.title: US judge won't block Florida law barring Chinese citizens from owning homes
